00017 package Apache::AuthenWeBWorK;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 Apache::AuthenWeBWorK - Authenticate against WeBWorK::Authen framework.
00022 
00023 =head1 CONFIGURATION
00024 
00025  PerlSetVar authen_webwork_root /path/to/webwork2
00026  PerlSetVar authen_webwork_course "some-course-id"
00027  PerlSetVar authen_webwork_module "WeBWorK::Authen::something"
00028 
00029 =cut
00030 
00031 use strict;
00032 use warnings;
00033 #use Apache::Constants qw(:common);
00034 use Apache2::Const -compile => qw(OK DECLINED HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED);
00035 use Apache2::Access ();
00036 use Apache2::RequestUtil ();
00037 
00038 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00039 use WeBWorK::Request;
00040 use WeBWorK::ContentGenerator;
00041 use WeBWorK::DB;
00042 use WeBWorK::Authz;
00043 use WeBWorK::Utils qw/runtime_use/;
00044 
00045 ################################################################################
00046 
00047 =head1 APACHE AUTHEN HANDLER
00048 
00049 =over
00050 
00051 =item handler($r)
00052 
00053 =cut
00054 
00055 sub handler($) {
00056     my ($apache) = @_;
00057     my $r = new WeBWorK::Request($apache);
00058     
00059     my ($res, $sent_pw) = $r->get_basic_auth_pw;
00060     return $res unless $res == Apache2::Const::OK;
00061     
00062     my $webwork_root = $r->dir_config('authen_webwork_root');
00063     my $webwork_course = $r->dir_config('authen_webwork_course');
00064     
00065     return fail($r, "authen_webwork_root not set")
00066         unless defined $webwork_root and $webwork_root ne "";
00067     return fail($r, "authen_webwork_course not set")
00068         unless defined $webwork_course and $webwork_course ne "";
00069     
00070     # FIXME most of this build-up code is yoinked from lib/WeBWorK.pm
00071     # needs to be factored out somehow
00072     # (for example, the authen module selection code probably belongs in a factory)
00073     
00074     my $ce = eval { new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00075         webwork_dir => $webwork_root,
00076         courseName => $webwork_course,
00077     }) };
00078     $@ and return fail($r, "failed to initialize the course environment: $@");
00079     $r->ce($ce);
00080     
00081     my $authz = new WeBWorK::Authz($r);
00082     $r->authz($authz);
00083     
00084     # figure out which authentication module to use
00085     my $user_authen_module;
00086     my $proctor_authen_module;
00087     if (ref $ce->{authen}{user_module} eq "HASH") {
00088         if (exists $ce->{authen}{user_module}{$ce->{dbLayoutName}}) {
00089             $user_authen_module = $ce->{authen}{user_module}{$ce->{dbLayoutName}};
00090         } else {
00091             $user_authen_module = $ce->{authen}{user_module}{"*"};
00092         }
00093     } else {
00094         $user_authen_module = $ce->{authen}{user_module};
00095     }
00096     
00097     runtime_use $user_authen_module;
00098     my $authen = $user_authen_module->new($r);
00099     $r->authen($authen);
00100     
00101     my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayout});
00102     $r->db($db);
00103     
00104     # now, here's the problem... WeBWorK::Authen looks at $r->params directly, whereas we
00105     # need to look at $user and $sent_pw. this is a perfect opportunity for a mixin, i think.
00106     my $authenOK;
00107     {
00108         no warnings 'redefine';
00109         local *WeBWorK::Authen::get_credentials   = \&Authen::WeBWorK::HTTPBasic::get_credentials;
00110         local *WeBWorK::Authen::maybe_send_cookie = \&Authen::WeBWorK::HTTPBasic::noop;
00111         local *WeBWorK::Authen::maybe_kill_cookie = \&Authen::WeBWorK::HTTPBasic::noop;
00112         local *WeBWorK::Authen::set_params        = \&Authen::WeBWorK::HTTPBasic::noop;
00113         
00114         $authenOK = $authen->verify;
00115     }
00116     
00117     
00118     debug("verify said: '$authenOK'");
00119     
00120     if ($authenOK) {
00121         debug("this will work!!!");
00122         #return OK;
00123         return Apache2::Const::OK;
00124     } else {
00125         #return AUTH_REQUIRED;
00126         return Apache2::Const::HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED;
00127     }
00128 }
00129 
00130 sub fail {
00131     my ($r, $msg) = @_;
00132         $r->note_basic_auth_failure;
00133         $r->log_reason($msg, $r->filename);
00134         #return AUTH_REQUIRED;
00135         return Apache2::Const::HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED;
00136 }
00137 
00138 =back
00139 
00140 =cut
00141 
00142 package Authen::WeBWorK::HTTPBasic;
00143 
00144 use strict;
00145 use warnings;
00146 use Apache2::Const -compile => qw(OK DECLINED HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED);
00147 use Apache2::Access ();
00148 use Apache2::RequestUtil ();
00149 #use Apache::Constants qw(:common);
00150 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00151 
00152 sub get_credentials {
00153     my ($self) = @_;
00154     my $r = $self->{r};
00155     
00156     my ($res, $sent_pw) = $r->get_basic_auth_pw;
00157     #return unless $res == OK;
00158     return unless $res == Apache2::Const::OK;
00159     my $user_id = $r->user;
00160     #my $user_id = $r->connection->user;
00161     
00162     #if (defined $r->connection->user) {
00163     if (defined $r->user) {
00164         $self->{user_id} = $r->user;
00165         $self->{password} = $sent_pw;
00166         $self->{credential_source} = "http_basic";
00167         return 1;
00168     }
00169 }
00170 
00171 sub noop {}
00172 
00173 1;
